External_Reference.reference_text: Vernov, S. N., Kontor, N. N., Lyubimov, G. P., Pereslegina, N. V., Chuchkov, E. A., Solar cosmic ray bursts in November - December 1970 according to data from Venus 7 space probe and Lunokhod 1 station, Space Res., vol. 12, 1535-1543, 1972 (Proc. of the 14th Plenary Meet., Seattle, WA, June 18-July 2, 1971).

Vernov, S. N., Vakulov, P. V., Getselev, I. V., Gorchakov, E. V., Grigorov, N. L., Ignatiev, P. P., Kontor, N. N., Kuznetsov, S. N., Logachev, Yu. I., Lyubimov, G. P., Nikolaev, A. G., Pereslegina, N. V., Pisarenko, N. F., Savenko, I. A., Tkachenko, V. I., Chuchkov, E. A., Yakovlev, V. A., Results of measurements of cosmic ray intensity with Venera 7, Space Res., vol. 10, no. 4, 561-568, 1972.

Vernov, S. N., Chudakov, A. E., Vakulov, P. V., Gorchakov, E. V., Ignatiev, P. P., Kontor, N. N., Logachev, Yu. I., Lyubimov, G. P., Nikolaev, A. G., Pereslegina, N. V., Measurement of cosmic rays and searching for radiation belts nearby Venus, in Physics of Moon and Planets (in Russian), Nauka, 397-402, 1972.

Instrument.name: Venera 7 Energetic Particles, MSU-TASPD
Instrument.description: The Venera 7 Energetic Particles experiment was a Soviet suite of particle detectors that monitored the flux of charged particles of medium energies in interplanetary space during cruise and Venus encounter, specifically measuring protons (>30, 1-5, and 4-12 MeV) from the sunward direction; and protons (1-5 and 4-12 MeV) from the anti-sunward direction.
